intro: Erysimum amasianum, commonly known as the Armenian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers with four petals, arranged in a cross shape typical of the Brassicaceae family. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
